info.title: Amazon RDS Instance API
info.description: The API for managing Amazon RDS Instances

parameters.name: AllocatedStorage
parameters.description: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) to be initially allocated for the        database instance.

parameters.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
parameters.description: Indicates that minor engine upgrades will be applied            automatically to the DB instance during the maintenance window.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The EC2 Availability Zone that the database instance will be created in. For information on        regions and Availability Zones, see         Regions        and Availability Zones.

parameters.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
parameters.description: The number of days for which automated backups are retained.        Setting this parameter to a positive number enables backups.        Setting this parameter to 0 disables automated backups.

parameters.name: CharacterSetName
parameters.description: For supported engines, indicates that the DB instance should be associated with the specified CharacterSet.

parameters.name: CopyTagsToSnapshot
parameters.description: True to copy all tags from the DB instance to snapshots of the DB instance; otherwise false.      The default is false.

parameters.name: DBClusterIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the DB cluster that the instance will belong to.

parameters.name: DBInstanceClass
parameters.description: The compute and memory capacity of the DB instance.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The DB instance identifier.        This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.

parameters.name: DBName
parameters.description: The meaning of this parameter            differs according to the database            engine you use.

parameters.name: DBParameterGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the DB parameter group to associate        with this DB instance. If this argument is omitted, the default        DBParameterGroup for the specified engine will be used.

parameters.name: DBSecurityGroups.member.N
parameters.description: A list of DB security groups to associate        with this DB instance.

parameters.name: DBSubnetGroupName
parameters.description: A DB subnet group to associate with this DB instance.

parameters.name: Engine
parameters.description: The name of the database engine to be used for this instance.

parameters.name: EngineVersion
parameters.description: The version number of the database engine to use.

parameters.name: Iops
parameters.description: The amount of Provisioned IOPS (input/output operations per second) to be initially allocated for the        DB instance.

parameters.name: KmsKeyId
parameters.description: The KMS key identifier for an encrypted DB instance.

parameters.name: LicenseModel
parameters.description: License model information for this DB instance.

parameters.name: MasterUsername
parameters.description: The name of master user for the client DB instance.

parameters.name: MasterUserPassword
parameters.description: The password for the master database user. Can be any printable ASCII character except /, , or @.

parameters.name: MonitoringInterval
parameters.description: The interval, in seconds, between points when Enhanced Monitoring metrics are collected for the DB instance.      To disable collecting Enhanced Monitoring metrics, specify 0. The default is 60.

parameters.name: MonitoringRoleArn
parameters.description: The ARN for the IAM role that permits RDS to send enhanced monitoring metrics to CloudWatch Logs. For    example, arn:aws:iam:123456789012:role/emaccess. For information on creating a monitoring role,      go to To         create an IAM role for Amazon RDS Enhanced Monitoring.

parameters.name: MultiAZ
parameters.description: Specifies if the DB instance is a Multi-AZ deployment.             You cannot set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the MultiAZ parameter is set to true.             Do not set this value if you want a Multi-AZ deployment for a SQL Server DB instance.             Multi-AZ for SQL Server is set using the Mirroring option in an option group.

parameters.name: OptionGroupName
parameters.description: Indicates that the DB instance should be associated with the specified option group.

parameters.name: Port
parameters.description: The port number on which the database accepts connections.

parameters.name: PreferredBackupWindow
parameters.description: The daily time range during which automated backups are created        if automated backups are enabled,        using the BackupRetentionPeriod parameter. For more information, see            DB                Instance Backups.

parameters.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
parameters.description: The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For more information, see            DB        Instance Maintenance.

parameters.name: PubliclyAccessible
parameters.description: Specifies the accessibility options for the DB instance.             A value of true specifies an Internet-facing instance with a publicly resolvable DNS name,            which resolves to a public IP address.            A value of false specifies an internal instance with a DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.

parameters.name: StorageEncrypted
parameters.description: Specifies whether the DB instance is encrypted.

parameters.name: StorageType
parameters.description: Specifies the storage type to be associated with the DB instance.

parameters.name: Tags.member.N
parameters.description: A list of tags.

parameters.name: TdeCredentialArn
parameters.description: The ARN from the Key Store with which to associate the instance for TDE encryption.

parameters.name: TdeCredentialPassword
parameters.description: The password for the given ARN from the Key Store in order to access the device.

parameters.name: VpcSecurityGroupIds.member.N
parameters.description: A list of EC2 VPC security groups to associate        with this DB instance.

get.summary: Creates a DB instance for a DB instance running MySQL, MariaDB, or PostgreSQL n    that acts as a Read Replica of a source DB instance.
get.description: Creates a DB instance for a DB instance running MySQL, MariaDB, or PostgreSQL n    that acts as a Read Replica of a source DB instance.

parameters.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
parameters.description: Indicates that minor engine upgrades will be applied automatically    to the Read Replica during the maintenance window.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone that the Read Replica will be created in.

parameters.name: CopyTagsToSnapshot
parameters.description: True to copy all tags from the Read Replica to snapshots of the Read Replica; otherwise false.      The default is false.

parameters.name: DBInstanceClass
parameters.description: The compute and memory capacity of the Read Replica.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The DB instance identifier of the Read Replica.    This identifier is the unique key that identifies a DB instance.    This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.

parameters.name: DBSubnetGroupName
parameters.description: Specifies a DB subnet group for the DB instance. The new DB instance will be created in the VPC associated with the DB subnet group.             If no DB subnet group is specified, then the new DB instance is not created in a VPC.

parameters.name: Iops
parameters.description: The amount of Provisioned IOPS (input/output operations per second) to be initially         allocated for the DB instance.

parameters.name: MonitoringInterval
parameters.description: The interval, in seconds, between points when Enhanced Monitoring metrics are collected for the Read Replica.      To disable collecting Enhanced Monitoring metrics, specify 0. The default is 60.

parameters.name: MonitoringRoleArn
parameters.description: The ARN for the IAM role that permits RDS to send enhanced monitoring metrics to CloudWatch Logs. For      example, arn:aws:iam:123456789012:role/emaccess. For information on creating a monitoring role,      go to To         create an IAM role for Amazon RDS Enhanced Monitoring.

parameters.name: OptionGroupName
parameters.description: The option group the DB instance will be associated with. If omitted, the default option group            for the engine specified will be used.

parameters.name: Port
parameters.description: The port number that the DB instance uses for connections.

parameters.name: PubliclyAccessible
parameters.description: Specifies the accessibility options for the DB instance.             A value of true specifies an Internet-facing instance with a publicly resolvable DNS name,            which resolves to a public IP address.            A value of false specifies an internal instance with a DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.

parameters.name: SourceDBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the DB instance that will act as the source for the Read Replica.    Each DB instance can have up to five Read Replicas.

parameters.name: StorageType
parameters.description: Specifies the storage type to be associated with the Read Replica.

parameters.name: Tags.member.N
parameters.description: A list of tags.

get.summary: The DeleteDBInstance action deletes a previously provisioned DB instance.
get.description: The DeleteDBInstance action deletes a previously provisioned DB instance.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The DB instance identifier for the DB instance to be deleted.        This parameter isnt case-sensitive.

parameters.name: FinalDBSnapshotIdentifier
parameters.description: The DBSnapshotIdentifier of the new DBSnapshot created when SkipFinalSnapshot        is set to false.

parameters.name: SkipFinalSnapshot
parameters.description: Determines whether a final DB snapshot is created before the DB instance is deleted.             If true is specified, no DBSnapshot is created. If false       is specified, a DB snapshot             is created before the DB instance is deleted.

get.summary: Returns information about provisioned RDS instances.
get.description: Returns information about provisioned RDS instances.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The user-supplied instance identifier.        If this parameter is specified, information from only the        specific DB instance is returned.        This parameter isnt case-sensitive.

parameters.name: Filters.member.N
parameters.description: This parameter is not currently supported.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous        DescribeDBInstances request.        If this parameter is specified, the response includes        only records beyond the marker,        up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to include in the response.        If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value,        a pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that the remaining        results can be retrieved.

get.summary: Returns a list of orderable DB instance options for the specified engine.
get.description: Returns a list of orderable DB instance options for the specified engine.

parameters.name: DBInstanceClass
parameters.description: The DB instance class filter value. Specify this parameter to show only the available offerings matching the specified DB instance class.

parameters.name: Engine
parameters.description: The name of the engine to retrieve DB instance options for.

parameters.name: EngineVersion
parameters.description: The engine version filter value. Specify this parameter to show only the available offerings matching the specified engine version.

parameters.name: Filters.member.N
parameters.description: This parameter is not currently supported.

parameters.name: LicenseModel
parameters.description: The license model filter value. Specify this parameter to show only the available offerings matching the specified license model.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous            DescribeOrderableDBInstanceOptions request.            If this parameter is specified, the response includes            only records beyond the marker,            up to the value specified by MaxRecords .

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to include in the response.            If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value,            a pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that the remaining            results can be retrieved.

parameters.name: Vpc
parameters.description: The VPC filter value. Specify this parameter to show only the available VPC or non-VPC offerings.

get.summary: Returns a list of resources (for example, DB instances) that have n           at least one pending maintenance action.
get.description: Returns a list of resources (for example, DB instances) that have n           at least one pending maintenance action.

parameters.name: Filters.member.N
parameters.description: A filter that specifies one or more resources to return pending maintenance actions for.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous            DescribePendingMaintenanceActions request.            If this parameter is specified, the response includes            only records beyond the marker,            up to a number of records specified by MaxRecords.

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to include in the response.            If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value,            a pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that the remaining            results can be retrieved.

parameters.name: ResourceIdentifier
parameters.description: The ARN of a resource to return pending maintenance actions for.

get.summary: Returns information about reserved DB instances for this account,n    or about a specified reserved DB instance.
get.description: Returns information about reserved DB instances for this account,n    or about a specified reserved DB instance.

parameters.name: DBInstanceClass
parameters.description: The DB instance class filter value.    Specify this parameter to show only those reservations    matching the specified DB instances class.

parameters.name: Duration
parameters.description: The duration filter value, specified in years or seconds.    Specify this parameter to show only reservations for this duration.

parameters.name: Filters.member.N
parameters.description: This parameter is not currently supported.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous request.        If this parameter is specified, the response includes        only records beyond the marker,        up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to include in the response.    If more than the MaxRecords value is available, a pagination token called a marker is    included in the response so that the following results can be retrieved.

parameters.name: MultiAZ
parameters.description: The Multi-AZ filter value. Specify this parameter to show only    those reservations matching the specified Multi-AZ parameter.

parameters.name: OfferingType
parameters.description: The offering type filter value.            Specify this parameter to show only the available            offerings matching the specified offering type.

parameters.name: ProductDescription
parameters.description: The product description filter value.    Specify this parameter to show only those reservations    matching the specified product description.

parameters.name: ReservedDBInstanceId
parameters.description: The reserved DB instance identifier filter value.    Specify this parameter to show only the reservation    that matches the specified reservation ID.

parameters.name: ReservedDBInstancesOfferingId
parameters.description: The offering identifier filter value.    Specify this parameter to show only purchased reservations    matching the specified offering identifier.

get.summary: Lists available reserved DB instance offerings.
get.description: Lists available reserved DB instance offerings.

parameters.name: DBInstanceClass
parameters.description: The DB instance class filter value.    Specify this parameter to show only the available offerings    matching the specified DB instance class.

parameters.name: Duration
parameters.description: Duration filter value, specified in years or seconds.    Specify this parameter to show only reservations for this duration.

parameters.name: Filters.member.N
parameters.description: This parameter is not currently supported.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous request.        If this parameter is specified, the response includes        only records beyond the marker,        up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to include in the response.    If more than the MaxRecords value is available, a pagination token called a marker is    included in the response so that the following results can be retrieved.

parameters.name: MultiAZ
parameters.description: The Multi-AZ filter value.    Specify this parameter to show only the available    offerings matching the specified Multi-AZ parameter.

parameters.name: OfferingType
parameters.description: The offering type filter value.            Specify this parameter to show only the available            offerings matching the specified offering type.

parameters.name: ProductDescription
parameters.description: Product description filter value.    Specify this parameter to show only the available    offerings matching the specified product description.

parameters.name: ReservedDBInstancesOfferingId
parameters.description: The offering identifier filter value.    Specify this parameter to show only the available offering    that matches the specified reservation identifier.

get.summary: Modify settings for a DB instance.
get.description: Modify settings for a DB instance.

parameters.name: AllocatedStorage
parameters.description: The new storage capacity of the RDS instance.        Changing this setting does not result in an outage and        the change is applied during the next maintenance window        unless ApplyImmediately is set        to true for this request.

parameters.name: AllowMajorVersionUpgrade
parameters.description: Indicates that major version upgrades are allowed.     Changing this parameter does not result in an outage and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.

parameters.name: ApplyImmediately
parameters.description: Specifies whether the modifications in this request and        any pending modifications are asynchronously applied        as soon as possible, regardless of the        PreferredMaintenanceWindow setting for the DB instance.

parameters.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
parameters.description: Indicates that minor version upgrades will be applied automatically    to the DB instance during the maintenance window.     Changing this parameter does not result in an outage except in the following case     and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.    An outage will result if this parameter is set to true during the maintenance window,     and a newer minor version is available, and RDS has enabled auto patching for that engine version.

parameters.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
parameters.description: The number of days to retain automated backups.        Setting this parameter to a positive number enables backups.        Setting this parameter to 0 disables automated backups.

parameters.name: CACertificateIdentifier
parameters.description: Indicates the certificate that needs to be associated with the instance.

parameters.name: CopyTagsToSnapshot
parameters.description: True to copy all tags from the DB instance to snapshots of the DB instance; otherwise false.      The default is false.

parameters.name: DBInstanceClass
parameters.description: The new compute and memory capacity of the DB instance. To determine the instance classes that are available for a particular             DB engine, use the DescribeOrderableDBInstanceOptions action.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The DB instance identifier.        This value is stored as a lowercase string.

parameters.name: DBParameterGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the DB parameter group to apply to the DB instance.             Changing this setting does not result in an outage. The parameter             group name itself is changed immediately, but the actual parameter             changes are not applied until you reboot the instance without             failover. The db instance will NOT be rebooted automatically             and the parameter changes will NOT be applied during the next maintenance window.

parameters.name: DBPortNumber
parameters.description: The port number on which the database accepts connections.

parameters.name: DBSecurityGroups.member.N
parameters.description: A list of DB security groups to authorize on this DB instance.        Changing this setting does not result in an outage and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.

parameters.name: EngineVersion
parameters.description: The version number of the database engine to upgrade to.     Changing this parameter results in an outage and the change     is applied during the next maintenance window    unless the ApplyImmediately parameter is set        to true for this request.

parameters.name: Iops
parameters.description: The new Provisioned IOPS (I/O operations per second) value for the RDS instance.             Changing this setting does not result in an outage and            the change is applied during the next maintenance window            unless the ApplyImmediately parameter is set            to true for this request.

parameters.name: MasterUserPassword
parameters.description: The new password for the DB instance master user. Can be any printable ASCII character except /, , or @.

parameters.name: MonitoringInterval
parameters.description: The interval, in seconds, between points when Enhanced Monitoring metrics are collected for the DB instance.      To disable collecting Enhanced Monitoring metrics, specify 0. The default is 60.

parameters.name: MonitoringRoleArn
parameters.description: The ARN for the IAM role that permits RDS to send enhanced monitoring metrics to CloudWatch Logs. For      example, arn:aws:iam:123456789012:role/emaccess. For information on creating a monitoring role,      go to To         create an IAM role for Amazon RDS Enhanced Monitoring.

parameters.name: MultiAZ
parameters.description: Specifies if the DB instance is a Multi-AZ deployment.     Changing this parameter does not result in an outage and the change     is applied during the next maintenance window    unless the ApplyImmediately parameter is set        to true for this request.

parameters.name: NewDBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The new DB instance identifier for the DB instance when renaming a DB            instance. When you change the DB instance identifier, an instance             reboot will occur immediately if you set Apply Immediately             to true, or will occur during the next maintenance window if             Apply Immediately to false. This value is stored             as a lowercase string.

parameters.name: OptionGroupName
parameters.description: Indicates that the DB instance should be associated with the specified option group.             Changing this parameter does not result in an outage except in the following case and the change             is applied during the next maintenance window            unless the ApplyImmediately parameter is set            to true for this request. If the parameter change results in an option group that             enables OEM, this change can cause a brief (sub-second) period during which new connections             are rejected but existing connections are not interrupted.

parameters.name: PreferredBackupWindow
parameters.description: The daily time range during which automated backups are created        if automated backups are enabled,        as determined by the BackupRetentionPeriod parameter.             Changing this parameter does not result in an outage and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.

parameters.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
parameters.description: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur,        which might result in an outage. Changing this parameter does not result in an outage, except in the following situation,        and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.        If there are pending actions that cause a reboot, and the maintenance window is changed to include the current time, then changing this        parameter will cause a reboot of the DB instance.        If moving this window to the current time,        there must be at least 30 minutes between the current time and        end of the window to ensure pending changes are applied.

parameters.name: PubliclyAccessible
parameters.description: True to make the DB instance Internet-facing with a publicly resolvable DNS name,      which resolves to a public IP address. False to make the DB instance internal       with a DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.

parameters.name: StorageType
parameters.description: Specifies the storage type to be associated with the DB instance.

parameters.name: TdeCredentialArn
parameters.description: The ARN from the Key Store with which to associate the instance for TDE encryption.

parameters.name: TdeCredentialPassword
parameters.description: The password for the given ARN from the Key Store in order to access the device.

parameters.name: VpcSecurityGroupIds.member.N
parameters.description: A list of EC2 VPC security groups to authorize on this DB instance.        This change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.

get.summary: Promotes a Read Replica DB instance to a standalone DB instance.
get.description: Promotes a Read Replica DB instance to a standalone DB instance.

parameters.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
parameters.description: The number of days to retain automated backups.        Setting this parameter to a positive number enables backups.        Setting this parameter to 0 disables automated backups.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The DB instance identifier.        This value is stored as a lowercase string.

parameters.name: PreferredBackupWindow
parameters.description: The daily time range during which automated backups are created        if automated backups are enabled,        using the BackupRetentionPeriod parameter.

get.summary: Purchases a reserved DB instance offering.
get.description: Purchases a reserved DB instance offering.

parameters.name: DBInstanceCount
parameters.description: The number of instances to reserve.

parameters.name: ReservedDBInstanceId
parameters.description: Customer-specified identifier to track this reservation.

parameters.name: ReservedDBInstancesOfferingId
parameters.description: The ID of the Reserved DB instance offering to purchase.

parameters.name: Tags.member.N
parameters.description: A list of tags.

get.summary: Rebooting a DB instance restarts the database engine service.
get.description: Rebooting a DB instance restarts the database engine service.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The DB instance identifier.        This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.

parameters.name: ForceFailover
parameters.description: When true, the reboot will be conducted through a MultiAZ failover.

get.summary: Creates a new DB instance from a DB snapshot.
get.description: Creates a new DB instance from a DB snapshot.

parameters.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
parameters.description: Indicates that minor version upgrades will be applied    automatically to the DB instance during the maintenance window.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The EC2 Availability Zone that the database instance will be created in.

parameters.name: CopyTagsToSnapshot
parameters.description: True to copy all tags from the restored DB instance to snapshots of the DB instance; otherwise false.      The default is false.

parameters.name: DBInstanceClass
parameters.description: The compute and memory capacity of the Amazon RDS DB instance.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: Name of the DB instance to create from the DB snapshot.            This parameter isnt case-sensitive.

parameters.name: DBName
parameters.description: The database name for the restored DB instance.

parameters.name: DBSnapshotIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the DB snapshot to restore from.

parameters.name: DBSubnetGroupName
parameters.description: The DB subnet group name to use for the new instance.

parameters.name: Engine
parameters.description: The database engine to use for the new instance.

parameters.name: Iops
parameters.description: Specifies the amount of provisioned IOPS for the DB instance, expressed in I/O operations per second.        If this parameter is not specified, the IOPS value will be taken from the backup. If this parameter         is set to 0, the new instance will be converted to a non-PIOPS instance, which will take additional         time, though your DB instance will be available for connections before the conversion starts.

parameters.name: LicenseModel
parameters.description: License model information for the restored DB instance.

parameters.name: MultiAZ
parameters.description: Specifies if the DB instance is a Multi-AZ deployment.

parameters.name: OptionGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the option group to be used for the restored DB instance.

parameters.name: Port
parameters.description: The port number on which the database accepts connections.

parameters.name: PubliclyAccessible
parameters.description: Specifies the accessibility options for the DB instance.             A value of true specifies an Internet-facing instance with a publicly resolvable DNS name,            which resolves to a public IP address.            A value of false specifies an internal instance with a DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.

parameters.name: StorageType
parameters.description: Specifies the storage type to be associated with the DB instance.

parameters.name: Tags.member.N
parameters.description: A list of tags.

parameters.name: TdeCredentialArn
parameters.description: The ARN from the Key Store with which to associate the instance for TDE encryption.

parameters.name: TdeCredentialPassword
parameters.description: The password for the given ARN from the Key Store in order to access the device.

get.summary: Restores a DB instance to an arbitrary point-in-time.
get.description: Restores a DB instance to an arbitrary point-in-time.

parameters.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
parameters.description: Indicates that minor version upgrades will be applied automatically to the DB instance during the maintenance window.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The EC2 Availability Zone that the database instance will be created in.

parameters.name: CopyTagsToSnapshot
parameters.description: True to copy all tags from the restored DB instance to snapshots of the DB instance; otherwise false.      The default is false.

parameters.name: DBInstanceClass
parameters.description: The compute and memory capacity of the Amazon RDS DB instance.

parameters.name: DBName
parameters.description: The database name for the restored DB instance.

parameters.name: DBSubnetGroupName
parameters.description: The DB subnet group name to use for the new instance.

parameters.name: Engine
parameters.description: The database engine to use for the new instance.

parameters.name: Iops
parameters.description: The amount of Provisioned IOPS (input/output operations per second) to be initially allocated for the        DB instance.

parameters.name: LicenseModel
parameters.description: License model information for the restored DB instance.

parameters.name: MultiAZ
parameters.description: Specifies if the DB instance is a Multi-AZ deployment.

parameters.name: OptionGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the option group to be used for the restored DB instance.

parameters.name: Port
parameters.description: The port number on which the database accepts connections.

parameters.name: PubliclyAccessible
parameters.description: Specifies the accessibility options for the DB instance.             A value of true specifies an Internet-facing instance with a publicly resolvable DNS name,            which resolves to a public IP address.            A value of false specifies an internal instance with a DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.

parameters.name: RestoreTime
parameters.description: The date and time to restore from.

parameters.name: SourceDBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the source DB instance from which to restore.

parameters.name: StorageType
parameters.description: Specifies the storage type to be associated with the DB instance.

parameters.name: Tags.member.N
parameters.description: A list of tags.

parameters.name: TargetDBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The name of the new database instance to be created.

parameters.name: TdeCredentialArn
parameters.description: The ARN from the Key Store with which to associate the instance for TDE encryption.

parameters.name: TdeCredentialPassword
parameters.description: The password for the given ARN from the Key Store in order to access the device.

parameters.name: UseLatestRestorableTime
parameters.description: Specifies whether (true) or not (false) the        DB instance is restored from the latest backup time.
